p: Further in majority of locations in India, groundnut is grown under rainfed conditions during monsoon season. Whenever a dry spell occurs, crop is exposed to drought conditions during the growth period. Drought conditions affect leaf expansion, photosynthesis and pod filling period which in turn affect shelling percentage ( Clifford et al., 1993), Hence providing one critical irrigation and growing drought-tolerant cultivars will be very effective under these conditions. In addition, earlier studies also showed that with better root structure such as increased root length density, drought tolerant cultivars extract more water from increasing soil depth ( Singh et al., 2012; Kadiyala et al., 2015).
